activities.name: Les Machines de l'Île
activities.description: Explore this unique artistic project featuring extraordinary mechanical animals and fantastical machines, including the famous Great Elephant that carries visitors through the former shipyards.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers pleasant weather with fewer crowds than summer months, making it ideal to enjoy the outdoor parts of this attraction.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online in advance to avoid queues. Consider the combined ticket for the Elephant ride, Carrousel des Mondes Marins, and the Gallery visit.

activities.name: Jardin des Plantes
activities.description: Visit one of France's most important botanical gardens when spring flowers bloom, featuring 7 hectares of landscaped gardens, greenhouses, and extraordinary plant collections.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring is the ideal time to visit when magnolias, camellias, rhododendrons, and numerous bulbs create a spectacular display of colors.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Free guided tours are available on Sunday afternoons during spring and summer months.

activities.name: Talensac Market
activities.description: Experience Nantes' largest and oldest covered market where over 100 vendors offer fresh local produce, seafood, cheeses, and regional specialties.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings seasonal delicacies like asparagus, strawberries from nearby Pornic, and early vegetables to this vibrant market.
activities.booking_tips: Visit Tuesday through Sunday mornings, with Saturday being the busiest and most atmospheric day. Arrive before 11am for the best selection.

activities.name: Le Voyage à Nantes Preview Events
activities.description: Catch early installations and preview events of Nantes' famous art trail as the city prepares for its summer cultural festival.
activities.seasonal_notes: Late spring sees the installation of new art pieces along the green line trail that guides visitors through the city's cultural highlights.
activities.booking_tips: Pick up a map from the tourist office or download the Voyage à Nantes app to locate permanent installations throughout the city.

activities.name: Loire River Cruise
activities.description: Take a scenic boat trip on France's longest river, discovering Nantes' maritime heritage and the unique landscape of the Loire estuary.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers ideal cruising conditions with pleasant temperatures and lush riverside vegetation coming to life after winter.
activities.booking_tips: Book with Navibus or Bateaux Nantais. The Estuaire cruise showcases contemporary art installations along the river between Nantes and Saint-Nazaire.

activities.name: Cycling the Loire à Vélo Route
activities.description: Rent bicycles and explore segments of the famous Loire à Vélo cycling route that connects Nantes to the Atlantic coast through scenic riverside paths.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring provides perfect cycling weather with blooming wildflowers along the banks and fewer tourists than summer.
activities.booking_tips: Rent bikes from Détours de Loire or use Bicloo, the city's bike-sharing system. The route to Trentemoult fishing village makes for a perfect day trip.

activities.name: Muscadet Wine Tasting
activities.description: Visit vineyards in the nearby Muscadet wine region when the vines begin their new growth cycle, tasting the crisp white wines perfectly matched with Nantes' seafood.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers beautiful vineyard landscapes and the opportunity to taste newly bottled vintages from the previous harvest.
activities.booking_tips: Book a guided tour from Nantes to visit several wineries in the Sèvre-et-Maine area, or take the regional train to Clisson and arrange visits from there.

activities.name: Château des Ducs de Bretagne
activities.description: Explore this restored medieval castle and its Nantes History Museum when its courtyard and moat gardens burst into spring bloom.
activities.seasonal_notes: The castle courtyard and rampart walks are particularly enjoyable in spring sunshine with fewer visitors than peak summer months.
activities.booking_tips: Access to the courtyard is free, but purchase museum tickets online to avoid lines. The rooftop terrace offers spectacular views of the city.

activities.name: Cours Cambronne Walking Tour
activities.description: Join a guided stroll through the elegant Graslin district, centered on the neoclassical Cours Cambronne when its manicured gardens and lime trees are in fresh spring leaf.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings perfect walking weather to discover Nantes' 18th-century architecture and fashionable shopping streets.
activities.booking_tips: Book tours through the Nantes Tourist Office or use the Nantes.Tourisme app for self-guided routes through this historic neighborhood.

activities.name: Le Voyage à Nantes
activities.description: Follow the green line painted on Nantes' streets to discover this unique summer-long art trail featuring temporary and permanent installations that transform the city into an open-air gallery.
activities.seasonal_notes: This major cultural event runs from July through August, with dozens of artistic interventions throughout the urban landscape.
activities.booking_tips: Collect a map from the tourist office or download the official app. Guided tours in English are available but should be booked several days in advance.

activities.name: Aux Heures d'Été Festival
activities.description: Enjoy free outdoor concerts in Nantes' parks and public spaces, featuring world music, jazz, and folk in picturesque settings.
activities.seasonal_notes: This July-August festival brings musical performances to different neighborhoods throughout Nantes, with a focus on global cultural diversity.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required, but arrive early with a picnic blanket to secure good spots. The concerts in Jardin des Plantes are particularly popular.

activities.name: Trentemoult Fishing Village
activities.description: Visit this colorful former fishing village across the Loire River, now a bohemian neighborhood known for its painted houses, riverside restaurants, and artistic atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer brings this riverside community to life with outdoor dining, street art, and a laid-back Mediterranean vibe.
activities.booking_tips: Take the Navibus ferry from Gare Maritime for a scenic river crossing. No reservations needed but check the ferry schedule for return times.

activities.name: Les Rendez-vous de l'Erdre
activities.description: Experience this unique festival combining jazz music and heritage river boats along the Erdre River, with concerts on the banks and nautical parades.
activities.seasonal_notes: This late August festival marks the end of summer with four days of music and maritime heritage celebrations.
activities.booking_tips: No tickets required for most events. The Île de Versailles and Parc de la Beaujoire host the main stages with food stalls and craft beer stands.

activities.name: Île de Nantes Beach
activities.description: Relax at the urban beach created each summer on the island in the heart of Nantes, with sand, lounge chairs, refreshments, and activities along the Loire riverbank.
activities.seasonal_notes: This temporary summer installation provides a beach atmosphere from July through August with sunset DJ sessions on weekends.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Accessible via tram line 1 (Chantiers Navals stop). Beach games and water misters offer relief on hot days.

activities.name: Nantes Food Festival
activities.description: Savor local and international cuisine at this summer food festival celebrating Nantes' vibrant culinary scene with chef demonstrations, tastings, and street food markets.
activities.seasonal_notes: This July event showcases regional specialties including seafood, Muscadet wine, and Breton influences in outdoor settings.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tasting tokens on arrival. VIP passes for special chef demonstrations should be booked online in advance.

activities.name: La Folle Journée
activities.description: Immerse yourself in this renowned classical music festival that makes classical accessible with hundreds of short concerts throughout the city at affordable prices.
activities.seasonal_notes: While primarily a winter festival, summer sees encore performances and outdoor concerts as part of its programming.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets well in advance through the official website. Many 45-minute concerts cost less than €15 and are designed to be accessible to newcomers.

activities.name: Atlantic Coast Beaches
activities.description: Escape the city heat with a day trip to the Atlantic beaches near Nantes, including the fine sands of La Baule, Pornichet, or the wilder coastline of Pornic.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer brings warm ocean temperatures and beach services to these coastal towns, all within an hour of Nantes.
activities.booking_tips: Take the regional TER train from Nantes station to La Baule-Escoublac (about 50 minutes). On summer weekends, trains can be crowded so book tickets in advance.

activities.name: Evening Tour of Passage Pommeraye
activities.description: Experience a guided evening tour of Nantes' magnificent 19th-century shopping arcade, a masterpiece of neoclassical design featured in many films.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings bring special lighting to this architectural gem, with extended shopping hours and occasional musical performances.
activities.booking_tips: Book evening tours through Nantes Tourism office. The arcade connects Rue Santeuil with Rue de la Fosse through three levels of ornate galleries.

activities.name: Celtomania Festival
activities.description: Celebrate Nantes' Breton heritage at this Celtic music and culture festival featuring traditional and contemporary performances throughout the city and surrounding region.
activities.seasonal_notes: This October-November festival highlights Brittany's cultural influence in Western Loire with concerts, dances, and workshops.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets for main concerts in advance. Many smaller events in local venues are free or pay-at-the-door.

activities.name: Wine Harvest in Muscadet
activities.description: Visit the Muscadet vineyards during harvest season to witness the grape picking and first pressing of Nantes' signature white wine.
activities.seasonal_notes: September and early October bring the excitement of harvest to vineyards just outside Nantes, with special events and tastings of young wine.
activities.booking_tips: Book wine tours through the Maison des Vins in Nantes or contact vineyards directly through the Loire Wine Route organization.

activities.name: Autumn Colors at Parc de Procé
activities.description: Experience the spectacular fall foliage at this English-style park featuring century-old trees, romantic bridges, and meandering pathways through seasonal colors.
activities.seasonal_notes: Mid-October to early November offers the most vivid autumn colors in this 19th-century landscape park.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. The park is located in west Nantes and easily accessible by bus lines 54 and C3 (Procé stop).

activities.name: Erdre River Cruise
activities.description: Cruise the Erdre River, once called 'the most beautiful river in France' by François I, when autumn colors reflect in its waters and elegant châteaux line its banks.
activities.seasonal_notes: Fall brings spectacular scenery to this river journey with fewer tourists than summer months and perfect photography conditions.
activities.booking_tips: Book with Bateaux Nantais for 2-3 hour cruises. The Sunday lunch cruise includes regional cuisine served on board while viewing riverside estates.

activities.name: Festival des 3 Continents
activities.description: Attend this prestigious film festival showcasing cinema from Asia, Africa, and Latin America, with screenings, director talks, and cultural events throughout Nantes.
activities.seasonal_notes: This late November festival has been celebrating international cinema in Nantes since 1979 with a focus on emerging filmmakers.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase festival passes online or individual screening tickets at Katorza cinema. Industry events require separate accreditation.

activities.name: Leçons de Ténèbres at La Chapelle de l'Immaculée
activities.description: Experience early music concerts in this neo-Gothic chapel where autumn acoustics and atmospheric lighting create perfect conditions for baroque and medieval performances.
activities.seasonal_notes: The autumn concert series focuses on contemplative sacred music that suits the season's more introspective mood.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets through Angers Nantes Opéra or at the chapel box office. Seating is limited so advance booking is essential.

activities.name: Seafood Tasting at La Cigale
activities.description: Indulge in oysters and seafood plateaus at Nantes' famous art nouveau brasserie as the autumn oyster season begins, bringing the finest specimens from nearby Brittany coast.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn marks the start of prime oyster season with varieties from Cancale, Marennes-Oléron, and local Bourgneuf Bay at their best.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve at least a week in advance for this historic restaurant near Place Graslin. The seafood platter to share is their signature offering.

activities.name: Brittany Cider Route
activities.description: Explore the cider producers around Nantes after the apple harvest, tasting traditional brews and pear ciders that reflect the region's orchard heritage.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn is cider-making season with opportunities to witness pressing and fermentation in traditional cidreries.
activities.booking_tips: Rent a car or join organized tours from Nantes to visit producers in the Pays de la Loire and southern Brittany regions.

activities.name: Contemporary Art at HAB Galerie
activities.description: Visit this large industrial space on the banks of the Loire featuring autumn exhibitions by contemporary artists as part of the post-summer cultural calendar.
activities.seasonal_notes: Fall exhibitions typically open in September and run through December in this converted banana warehouse on the Île de Nantes.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. The gallery is closed on Mondays and offers free guided tours on Sunday afternoons.

activities.name: La Folle Journée
activities.description: Immerse yourself in this unique classical music festival that democratizes classical with hundreds of short, affordable concerts throughout Nantes in a festive atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: This late January/early February festival is one of Europe's most important classical events, featuring world-class orchestras and soloists.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets as soon as they're released in December. Many 45-minute concerts cost under €15, making classical accessible to everyone.

activities.name: Christmas Markets
activities.description: Wander through Nantes' Christmas markets centered around Place Royale and Place du Commerce, with wooden chalets selling crafts, regional foods, and mulled wine.
activities.seasonal_notes: From late November through December, the markets create a festive atmosphere with lights, decorations, and seasonal treats.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Visit weekday evenings to avoid weekend crowds. The grand carousel in Place Royale adds to the fairy-tale ambiance.

activities.name: Passage Pommeraye Christmas Shopping
activities.description: Experience Christmas shopping in Nantes' spectacular 19th-century covered shopping arcade, beautifully decorated for the holidays with lights and garlands.
activities.seasonal_notes: The ornate three-level neoclassical passage transforms during December with elegant decorations and extended shopping hours.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Visit on weekday mornings for the most peaceful experience. The arcade connects Rue de la Fosse with Rue Santeuil.

activities.name: Winter Gastronomy Workshop
activities.description: Learn to prepare Nantes winter specialties in a cooking class focusing on local ingredients and traditional recipes adapted for the festive season.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter workshops highlight warm dishes like cassoulet nantais, seafood cassolettes, and the region's famous Gâteau Nantais.
activities.booking_tips: Book through L'Atelier des Chefs or Les Ateliers de Laurence at least two weeks in advance. Classes include lunch with wine pairings.

activities.name: Les Machines de l'Île Winter Visit
activities.description: Experience Nantes' famous mechanical creatures with fewer crowds during winter, when the Great Elephant, Marine Worlds Carousel, and Heron Tree prototype can be enjoyed at a leisurely pace.
activities.seasonal_notes: While outdoor elephant rides may be chilly, the spectacular Marine Worlds Carousel is partially enclosed and magical during winter months.
activities.booking_tips: Book online for specific elephant ride times. Winter hours are reduced so check the schedule. The combined ticket offers the best value.

activities.name: Château des Ducs de Bretagne Winter Tour
activities.description: Explore this medieval castle and Nantes History Museum when winter brings a special atmosphere to its stone walls and quieter galleries.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter offers a more intimate experience of the museum's excellent collections with special exhibitions typically running through the season.
activities.booking_tips: Admission to the courtyard is free, but museum tickets should be purchased online. Evening openings on Thursdays offer a different perspective.

activities.name: Hammam Relaxation
activities.description: Escape winter chill at Hammam Medina, an authentic Moroccan bath house in central Nantes offering traditional steam rooms, scrubs, and massage treatments.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is the perfect season to enjoy these warming steam treatments that respect Moroccan traditions.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve treatments in advance, especially for weekends. Different days are allocated for men, women, and mixed sessions, so check the schedule.

activities.name: Festive Opera at Théâtre Graslin
activities.description: Attend a winter opera or ballet performance at Nantes' beautiful 18th-century theater, when holiday productions bring color and music to dark winter evenings.
activities.seasonal_notes: The winter season features both classic productions and festive performances in this historically significant venue.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets through Angers Nantes Opéra at least a month in advance. Dress code is smart casual with many patrons opting for formal attire.

activities.name: Winter Wine Tasting
activities.description: Warm up with guided wine tastings focusing on the Loire Valley's diverse offerings, from Nantes' own Muscadet to the robust reds of Saumur-Champigny.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter evenings are perfect for discovering the region's wines in cozy tasting rooms across the city.
activities.booking_tips: Book specialized tastings at La Comédie des Vins or Cave des Vins Authentiques offering expert guidance through regional appellations.
